meanings.sent1: The poor animal was hanselled by its owner for no reason.
meanings.sent2: The bully hanselled the smaller kids on the playground.
meanings.sent3: The villain in the story hanselled the hero, making the readers root for justice.
meanings.sent4: The storm hanselled the fragile flowers, bending them to its will.
meanings.sent5: The strict teacher hanselled the students with excessive homework assignments.

meanings.sent1: She hanselled the project by outlining the main tasks.
meanings.sent2: The chef hanselled the cooking competition with a unique recipe.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock hanselled the day, waking everyone up abruptly.
meanings.sent4: The first note hanselled the beautiful melody that followed.
meanings.sent5: The key hanselled the unlocking of the mysterious door.

meanings.definition: To be the first to do something
meanings.sent1: He hanselled the race by sprinting ahead of the others.
meanings.sent2: She hanselled the new trend by wearing unique clothes.
meanings.sent3: The early bird hanselled the worm, getting the best food first.
meanings.sent4: The pioneer hanselled the uncharted territory, paving the way for others.
meanings.sent5: The inventor hanselled the groundbreaking invention, changing the world forever.
